abstracts.cdata!:
This report is a project performance
            review of the Fourth Highway Project in Paraguay.
            Paraguay's highway network, including the primitive
            track system serves the Chaco, totals about 8,500 km of
            which some 6,700 km are under the jurisdiction of the
            Ministerio de Obras Publicas y Comunicaciones (MOPC). Of the
            latter, some 85 percent are unpaved and susceptible to
            closure for up to 100 days per year because of rain. Road
            development has been concentrated on paving the more heavily
            trafficked roads and expanding the network to connect
            economic and population centers. Adequate maintenance is
            critical and improvements are required to meet growing
            traffic volumes and facilitate the development of new
            agricultural areas. This completion report is based on
            information obtained from the files of the Bank's
            record center; Latin America and Caribbean (LAC) information
            center; and appraisal and supervision reports for loan
            1059-PA and on the final reports prepared by consultants
            responsible for supervision of the civil works.
